These Italians say this kind of declaration might have been
sufficient to ease the pressure on Pella and, if so, would have left
him in a stronger long-run position. But others doubt that Pella could
have survived, with nothing more than another pious pledge to show for
his efforts on Trieste.
Pella’s position with the country still seems to be very strong*
But it is on the floor of the parliament that he will survive or fall.
And it is there where the pressures from the strengthened parties
of the political Right are building up* It is there where those
pressures could become unbearable for the man from Piedmont in the
coming weeks and months unless he can bring in something tangible on
the iscue that arouses Italian passions more than any other these days*
This is Graham Hovey, signing off another letter from Italy* This
program was recorded in the Rome studios of Radio Italians for the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters — and this is the
NAEB Tape Network*
